website_summaries.verdict: Choose this tent if you are looking for a model that's easy to set up and has ventilation that's ideal for warm conditions. The long warranty is a welcome bonus.
pros: Earns praise for the dual vestibules and airy mesh that make it a perfect summertime tent
Freestanding poles can be set up in seconds
Backed by an outstanding limited lifetime warranty
cons: In very chilly temperatures, you may get cold at night in this tent
Can feel a bit heavy if you take it backpacking

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to set-up and spacious on the inside
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to set-up and spacious on the inside. I also love that they color-coordinated the corner straps with the bottom tarp as well as the base of the poles - the larger side of the tent where the poles with the 'kink' go is black, and the smaller side orange. It makes set-up really easy! I also really like the additional corner pockets inside to hold my phone, keys, etc. and they do have a net that hangs from the top, but unfortunately this could use some improvement as my phone and any items I would place up there continue to fall out.
customer_reviews.author: Lois Mueller

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic tent!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic tent! We dubbed it the MVP of our four days/three nights canoe trip in Algonquin Park. Weather was awful, with incessant rain, and plenty of wind. Tent was dry, dry, dry, No stretch either, so never had to readjust the guy lines. pockets in each of 4 corners were handy for holding glasses, kindle, flashlight, etc. Excellent ventilation, but probably too much for use in cold weather. Tent is a tad heavy, but worth the few extra ounces in my opinion. Three person tent was plenty big for two, 200+ lb. men. Looked at several of the more usual name brands, and decided on this one for features and lower price. Was well-rewarded! Good job ALPS.
customer_reviews.author: Steve S

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Tent
customer_reviews.text: Worked like a charm for 4-day trip. With the footprint, absolutely no water got in despite over-saturated ground and 3/4 days raining! Love the design of the two vestibules for muddy gear and cooler.Think I'll enjoy the openness without the rainfly when I get the chance. This tent is the easiest I've ever assembled and I did it solo. The tags on the corners (where you put in poles) are color-coded for each part, including the footprint! Great attention to detail.
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: So far so good. I'm not gonna lie though
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I'm not gonna lie though, I struggled setting this baby up. A bit confusing, even after reading/rereading instructions, and looking at pictures online, but when I got the tent up it looked/felt sturdy. I've only set it up in my backyard, so time will tell about it's durability on my next camping trip.
customer_reviews.author: KLH

customer_reviews.title: great tent for 2 people
customer_reviews.text: my husband and i are in our 60s, and we love to camp, but we needed a tent that would accommodate our extremely comfortable, large ground pads. this tent is the ticket! it is SUPER easy to assemble and seems very well made. we love the 2 door feature. i didn't rate it a 5 on warmth, because, come on! it's a TENT! That said, it does cut the wind well.
customer_reviews.author: kathleen brown

customer_reviews.title: Great tent!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put up and stake out. Vestibules keep shoes and packs dry and out of the tent. We camp with an impatient 40 pound Staffordshire Terrier who has run full on into and set his claws into the mesh screen doors. The mesh has amazingly withstood this punishment! Perfect size tent for 2 average size humans and the aforementioned dog. Best tent I've owned to date.
customer_reviews.author: Diana M. Zaccaria, DC

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't have asked for a better design.
customer_reviews.text: I hope this tent works forever, it's perfect for my camping trips. I "car camp" with my kids a few times a year, and I take solo canoe trips every summer. This tent is perfect. It sets up and packs away easily. The hardest part is getting the rain fly on the first time every year because I put it on backwards. When my son begins camping with Boy Scouts, he's going to get an ALPS tent like this because of how happy I am with it.
customer_reviews.author: Dad of 2

customer_reviews.title: Great tent == wish it was 5 lbs but
customer_reviews.text: So do lots of hiking -- and moving into camping -- did a 10 mile in first day then another 10 -- the tent is very roomie, well made, comfortable, and a great overall product. For extended hiking (4-5 days) a bit on the heavy side. I would buy this again but not sure if i would go was their lighter model. However as out of car camping this is a great fit or for 2 day trip, it is excellent
customer_reviews.author: rich banholzer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up and break down
customer_reviews.text: Heeding the advice in other reviews I used Kiwi CampDry on all the rain fly seams to prevent any possible leak from the cross pole. It poured and dropped below 50° our first night camping in this tent and myself and toddler stayed warm and dry the entire night. Easy to set up and break down. Good size. Fit myself, toddler and tall husband in comfortably.
customer_reviews.author: Adventures with Aubrey

customer_reviews.title: Great sturdy tent!!
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I went out to the sierra mountains and used this nice tent. It comfortably fits two of us and we had our adult size husky with us. We were at the top of the mountain and the winds were blowing but it stood its ground. I recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Alejandro R.

customer_reviews.title: I also like the color codeing on the straps on the bottom ...
customer_reviews.text: I was very impressed with this tent and the size it packs down to. I packed up in northern Minnesota for a week and was hit by heavy rains the last couple nights, to my suprise i was dry both mornings. All i did was spray a little silicone on the rain fly. I also like the color codeing on the straps on the bottom of the tent to where u attach to the rain fly. The only thing i not impressed with is some brass rings fell out but most of the tent was designed and constucted very well.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua D Noble

customer_reviews.title: possibly the best design available for backcountry hunting and fishing trips
customer_reviews.text: While a bit heavy at 7 lbs with footprint, possibly the best design available for backcountry hunting and fishing trips. Dual doors and vestibules are ideal for two people and gear. Generous center height makes for a comfortable stay when the weather turns nasty. Goes up in minutes. One person can do it, but easier with two.
customer_reviews.author: Gene S.

customer_reviews.title: Arrived incomplete; instructions terrible
customer_reviews.text: Arrived missing three ties/ropes for the fly and was short a few ground stakes. Instructions laughably bad. I figured out how to put it up (wasn't that hard, but my daughter's REI tent has great instructions). Did not sleep in the tent yet, but looks spacious for two, probably tight for three. Interior pockets seemed to be lacking. Kind of expected these issues given the low low low price.
customer_reviews.author: Dana Brooke Levy

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: This was perfect for two people. Easy to put up. Rained the one night and had no issues
customer_reviews.author: laura

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Tent For Two
customer_reviews.text: I really like this tent, it's easy to set up, looks great, and has plenty of headroom. I went camping last week and my girlfriend and I fit in here perfectly. With my bag and shoes in the vestibule space, we could probably have even fitted a third person (though it would be cozy). It's fairly light too (especially compared to my Coleman 5 person) and I plan on taking this backpacking very soon. Super happy with my purchase so far.
customer_reviews.author: Justin G

customer_reviews.title: but overall a great tent. Super easy to set up and take ...
customer_reviews.text: The top sheet and the doors don't line up perfectly, which can make it a little cold in breezy weather, but overall a great tent. Super easy to set up and take down. Took it backpacking in the Grand Canyon and it was nice to keep the top off and see the stars, there were two of us and it was big enough to keep our packs in and have extra room. Don't think you'll find a better tent for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren crisafi

customer_reviews.title: Christmas
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for a Christmas gift for my grandson, he was so happy with it plans on camping news years .
customer_reviews.author: DianaCrane

customer_reviews.title: easy to put together
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight, easy to put together. Strong in moderate wind. When used without the rain fly, very breezy, so great for hot climates.
customer_reviews.author: kvl224

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.text: Had it for several years and I'm hard on gear . works absolutely great. Especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: C

customer_reviews.title: Solid construction, easy to assemble / re-pack.
customer_reviews.text: This is a solid backpacking tent. It isn't the lightest, but after 5 trips +/- it seems to be holding up nicely.
customer_reviews.author: ky_yaege

customer_reviews.title: Great tent...
customer_reviews.text: My first outing with this tent was with a pretty large group. It rained violently the first two nights. While my friends with cheaper tents got wet, I stayed nice and dry. The instructions that come with the tent could be a little better, but it's really not that difficult to figure out. Great tent.
customer_reviews.author: S

customer_reviews.title: Great tent. Packs well and very spacious and durable looking.
customer_reviews.text: Had this tent set up on two different trips so far and have no complaints yet. The first outing was hot and didn't need the rain fly and spent the night bug free. Love the pockets on top and on the sides for cell phone or lights.
customer_reviews.author: tybow

customer_reviews.title: Great Tent, good buy!
customer_reviews.text: This tent was a great price and is excellent quality. it is lightweight and packs up nicely. We bought it for motorcycle camping. Even though there is only 2 of us, we got the 3-person tent to have room for luggage and supplies. It would also be great for regular tent camping.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia B. Hovis

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my California camping lifestyle
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my California camping lifestyle. mesh netting allows warm starie nights and tarp cover protects you very well from those nights with more elements. Would confidently take this on a rainy weekend too.
customer_reviews.author: Seth

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: Decent tent features and construction for the price. My use is is SW desert to keep the critters out while I sleep. Plenty of room and ventilation.
customer_reviews.author: Bloke

customer_reviews.title: Amazing tent. My husband and I had a great ...
customer_reviews.text: Amazing tent. My husband and I had a great time in this tent with our 2 dogs. We loved taking the canopy off during the day and taking a nap.
customer_reviews.author: Loading........

customer_reviews.title: As others have said, the rainfly tends to leak ...
customer_reviews.text: As others have said, the rainfly tends to leak where the center pole hooks into the eyelets of the rainfly. Mine also leaked on the velcro straps where the fly hooks to the tent poles. None of them were major, but we did put a plastic bag over the eyelets to collect water!
customer_reviews.author: Kelson Moran

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight,compact
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight and compact nice tub style bottom would buy again
customer_reviews.author: customer

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: This tent, for the price was awesome. Very easy to put up and take down. I also purchased the base footprint to help protect the bottom and that worked well. It is a little small for a 3 person tent and you could probably squeeze them in. Perfect for 1 or 2 with gear. It rained the first morning and I had no leaks in the seams as reported by other reviewers. I will still probably be treating the canopy just in case. I would pick up a small tarp to lay out for your shoes just outside the tent but under the canopy to protect from mud and stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great tent! Easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: Great tent! Easy to set up, fit two humans and a very wiggly dog very comfortably, with plenty of room for packs inside, or in the vestibules if we chose to leave them outside.
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: Great tent.
customer_reviews.text: Great tent. Quick to put up. Good zippers Secound year camping and holding up great. Love how much mesh there is. Really get to enjoy the sky.
customer_reviews.author: JA TECH

customer_reviews.title: So far its help up great. Setup is easy
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this tent for back packing. So far its help up great. Setup is easy. Just came back from camping in Yosemite National Park and this tent kept me and my wife dry during the storm. Awesome purchase
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: They survive tough scout trips with ease.
customer_reviews.text: Took theses on several years worth of scout trips. The boys took care of them for years. When it was time for replacements I knew I wouldn’t by a different tent.
customer_reviews.author: Emily A. Green

customer_reviews.title: Super happy with my purchase
customer_reviews.text: We were in a crazy rainstorm with this tent. A couple of mini drops came in during the downpour, but it was dry inside. Super happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Rehana Mohammed-Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great Tent!
customer_reviews.text: Great tent - lightweight and it performed well in wind and rain. Out scout troop used it on a 12-day backpacking trip to Philmont, as we had an odd number of boys so three needed to tent together.
customer_reviews.author: Iman Apeman

customer_reviews.title: Great So Far
customer_reviews.text: So far I only have one small misgiving about this tent. There is a bit of confusion every time we set it up because the stays are unidirectional, but their orientation is not apparent at a glance. Otherwise it seems to be the best tent I have owned. It is spacious, with tons of headroom. It seems very stable in wind. It is warm and bug-tight. Haven't had it in a rainstorm yet. I'll update if that happens because, let's face it, for everybody who has ever gotten wet, that is the ONE THING that matters above all else.
customer_reviews.author: Like It Is

customer_reviews.title: Worked great in heavy two days of rain along the Kern ...
customer_reviews.text: Took it backpacking with my son and our weimeraner. Worked great in heavy two days of rain along the Kern River . No leaks at all.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: easy to set up and perfect for two + gear
customer_reviews.text: light, easy to set up and perfect for two + gear.
customer_reviews.author: Austinite

customer_reviews.title: A great tent
customer_reviews.text: The tent showed up in a reasonable time. It was very easy to set up. The tent is very spacious and I would highly recommend it
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Airy, comfortable sleeping
customer_reviews.text: I bought a three person tent to make sure two people would fit comfortably. Easy to set up and great for backpacking. Very airy without the reason fly.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin McAtee

customer_reviews.title: It's Big
customer_reviews.text: Shipped in two days. When I got it I put it up in my living room, and let me tell you its a big tent. Slightly heavier than I thought but still light enough to put in a pack. But again you have plenty of room. I plan on using this for scouts as an adult leader I will update after I get to use the tent, but so far so good!!!
customer_reviews.author: Scorps9

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Easy to setup, perfect size for two with gear - great 2-3 season BB tent
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice tent
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice tent for the money. It’s probably more like a 2+ person tent. Decent ventilation. Nice sized vestibules. Easy setup even with one person. I like it.
customer_reviews.author: Just a Dude

product_meta.title: ALPS Mountaineering Aries 3-Person Tent
feature_bullets: There's no assembly frustration with our Aries Tent series; this aluminum, free-standing pole system allows for quick setup
Polyester tent fly resists water and UV damage while adding two vestibules for extra storage space
Great ventilation and star-gazing opportunities with mesh roof and walls
Fully equipped with #8 zippers, mesh storage pocket, gear loft, aluminum stakes and guy ropes
Base Size: 6'9 x 7'4, Center Height: 50", Total Weight: 7 lbs. 4 oz., Minimum Weight: 6 lbs. 7 oz., Color: Copper/Rust

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
